newsitem.title: GERMANY: Adidas denies analyst meeting rumours.
newsitem.headline: Adidas denies analyst meeting rumours.

text.p: German sportswear maker Adidas AG on Monday denied market rumours that it had held an analyst meeting last week and also that it has revised downward its financial outlook.
"We did not have an analyst meeting last week and we have not revised our outlook," an Adidas spokesman told Reuters.
He said that Adidas would go foward as scheduled with the release of its third quarter results on November 12.
"There has been no change in our outlook. There is no reason to do so," he said.
Shares in Adidas were under pressure last week on rumours that certain banks had downgraded their earnings outlook and that an analyst meeting had taken place.
Adidas shares ended bourse trade on Monday up 2.70 marks at 134.70 marks, outpacing gains in the 30-share DAX index which rose 29.61 points to 2,703.83.
